Text:
Lol, it seems this is the only extended version, everybody else left out the scene after credits ;-)
Not a big deal, it's only half a minute.

The only way to decode TrueHD 7.1 was with dvdfab to wav 5.1. Then encoded the wav to DTS but it sounded inferior to the DD-5.1 640. 
So I added then the Dolby track. 
Don't worry, it's crispy and loud.
